movies.title: The Blade
movies.plot: After the master of the Sharp Manufacturer saber factory abdicates and appoints On, his least popular worker, as his successor, On, unwilling to lead his surly colleagues, embarks on a quest of revenge to kill the evil, flying, tattooed kung fu master who killed his father.
movies.simplePlot: After the master of the Sharp Manufacturer saber factory abdicates and appoints On, his least popular worker, as his successor, On, unwilling to lead his surly colleagues, embarks on a ...

biography.bio: Wenzhuo Zhao was born on April 10, 1972 in Ning'an, Heilongjiang, China. He is an actor, known for True Legend (2010), The Blade (1995) and Green Snake (1993).
biography.name: Wenzhuo Zhao

biography.bio: Xin Xin Xiong was born on February 25, 1965. He is known for his work on Once Upon a Time in China (1991), Black Mask (1996) and Double Team (1997).
biography.name: Xin Xin Xiong

biography.bio: Sonny Su was born on June 8, 1966 in Taiwan as Tsui-yu Su. She is an actress, known for The Blade (1995), Te jing shen long (1994) and Lucky Encounter (1992).
biography.name: Sonny Su

biography.bio: Valerie Chow was born in Hong Kong as Ka-Ling Chow, the only daughter of a well-off family. In 1991, she won Miss Hong Kong Pageant as the first runner up. She went back to Hong Kong University to finish her law degree before returning, in 1993, to her acting career. Chow's career kicked off with a good start with "Wan 9 Zhao 5" (Twenty Something), in which she played Alice, a girl who tries to find true love in Hong Kong's club scenes. Then came her big break, "Chungking Express", in which she plays the woman who broke Tony Leung's heart. She had only a few scenes, but made quite an impression. The blurry image of her wearing a bra and a skirt, walking around the house as if she is swaying in and out of space (and Leung's memory), made Chow a symbol of mysterious seduction. After Chungking Express, Chow did a 20-eposide TV series, playing the outside interest of a honest married man; who eventually divorced his fat, cooking-oil-soaked wife. The series itself was a huge success, but her role was not warmly received, and her career began to go downwards. She went on to star in a string of insignficant films, which either showed her as a two-dimensional seductress, or tried unsuccessfully to "cleanse" her image as a home-wrecker. She finally decided to move to the States and start fresh. However, Chow's career in Hollywood was equally uneventful, with the exception of her Revlon contract. After returning to Hong Kong, she found a job working for the marketing and events department of Lane Crawford, the Hong Kong equivalent of Neiman Marcus; and acting became her part-time job. Ironically, one of her latest part-time jobs, a 40-episode TV series called "Hap Qua Yin Som" (Healing Hearts), was her biggest success ever. Her role, a lawyer named Flora, was recognized as the perfect modern woman--smart, beautiful, and independent. The success of Healing Hearts led to another major cosmetic contract--Chow signed on to become the spokeperson for Neutrogena's whitening mask, a new line that was launched in Hong Kong.
biography.name: Valerie Chow

biography.bio: Collin Chou was born on August 11, 1967 in Taiwan as Hsiao-Lung Chou. He is known for his work on Matrix Revolutions (2003), The Matrix Reloaded (2003) and Fearless (2006). He has been married to Wanda Yung since December 10, 1997. They have two children.
biography.name: Collin Chou

biography.bio: Chi Fai Chan is known for his work on A Better Tomorrow (1986), Police Story 2 (1988) and City on Fire (1987).
biography.name: Chi Fai Chan

biography.bio: Moses Chan was born on April 16, 1971 in Hong Kong as Chan Ho. He is an actor, known for Black Mask (1996), Piège à Hong Kong (1998) and Wan 9 zhao 5 (1994). He has been married to Aimee Chan since June 11, 2013. They have three children.
biography.name: Moses Chan

biography.bio: Ray Chang is an actor and writer, known for Lethal Weapon 4 (1998), Strange Days (1995) and Dunston Checks In (1996).
biography.name: Ray Chang

biography.bio: Szu-Ying Chien was born on February 22, 1910 in China. She was an actress and costume designer, known for In the Mood for Love (2000), All for the Winner (1990) and Endless Love (1993). She was married to Ji Hong. She died on October 15, 2007 in Hong Kong.
biography.name: Szu-Ying Chien

biography.bio: Kin-sang Chow is an actor, known for The Blade (1995).
biography.name: Kin-sang Chow

biography.bio: Jason Chu is an actor, known for Young and Dangerous 3 (1996), Young and Dangerous (1996) and Young and Dangerous 2 (1996).
biography.name: Jason Chu

biography.bio: Bik-Ha Chung is an actress, known for The Blade (1995).
biography.name: Bik-Ha Chung

biography.bio: Wing-Chan 'Emily' Chung is an actress, known for Abandon (2002) and The Blade (1995).
biography.name: Wing-Chan 'Emily' Chung

biography.placeOfBirth: Kowloon City, Hong Kong, British Crown Colony
biography.bio: Ka-Kui Ho was born on March 14, 1951 in Kowloon City, Hong Kong, British Crown Colony. He is known for his work on Riki-Oh: The Story of Ricky (1991), Prison on Fire (1987) and La secte du lotus blanc (1992). He died on January 27, 2015 in Hong Kong.
biography.name: Ka-Kui Ho

biography.bio: Ricky Ho is known for his work on Zu Warriors (2001), Beyond Beauty: Taiwan from Above (2013) and Warriors of the Rainbow (2011).
biography.name: Ricky Ho

awards.award: Hong Kong Film Critics Society Awards 1996
